label: Description
value: Square tile. Grayish white ground, centered with slate blue figure of a boy in the Chinese manner. Figure faces the observer and carries two buckets which depend from the ends of a board behind his back. Margins filled with crude floral ornament in overglaze white. Examples of "bianco sopra bianco" technique.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (laying flat): 12.5 x 12.5 cm (4 15/16 x 4 15/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Square tile. Center reserved in white, with male figure in Chinese style, manganese and blue, standing on green and yellow mound. Blue border with double row of black circles and dots; flower quadrants at the corners.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (laying flat): 12.6 x 12.6 cm (4 15/16 x 4 15/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Square tile. Decorated in "Fazackerley colors" on white ground.  Subject a blue vase with flowers in blue, yellow, manganese and brown; leaves sage green, with black veins.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (laying flat): 11.9 x 12.5 cm (4 11/16 x 4 15/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Square tile. Medallion enclosing landscape with shepherdess seated on a fountain at the right, and animals at left. Colors: manganese, pale green, deep blue, chrome yellow and brick red.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (laying flat): 13 x 13 cm (5 1/8 x 5 1/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Square tile. "Mr. [William Thomas] Lewis in the Character of Douglas". Standing figure, armed, body facing observer, head to left, one hand resting on bow at left. Latticed border with trophies and a banderole. Design from Bell's British Theatre, 1776-78.

label: Physical description
value: Tin-enamelled earthenware, transfer-printed back on white

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (laying flat): 12.7 x 12.8 cm (5 x 5 1/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Square tile, blue on white. Soldier with helmet and breastplate standing with back in three-quarters view. Left arm akimbo, right hand at side, holding gun. Symmetrical scroll ornaments in the corner.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Square tile with decoration in manganese on a white ground. Subject: a medallion enclosing a landscape at the shore, with two boats, figures rowing; large sponged tree at left. Symmetrical ornaments at the corners.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (laying flat): 13.1 x 13.1 cm (5 3/16 x 5 3/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Piece of linen from which certain threads have been drawn leaving ground in a scroll pattern. An unfinished example of drawn work.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: withdrawn element with embroidery stitches

label: Description
value: Piece of linen ornamented by drawn work at one side. One border of fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: withdrawn element with embroidery stitches

label: Description
value: Square tile, centered with bust of woman in cusped medallion. Subject, head one quarter to right, holds flower to nose, wears gown with imbricated patter. Colors: flesh, green, blue, and olive brown.

label: Description
value: Square deep dish with fluted and scalloped edge. Overglaze printed decoration in black, of shells and seaweed. Gold medallion and border.

label: Provenance
value: Miss Marie Russell; 1938: acquired y Museum

label: Description
value: Horizontal formal garden with fountain and strolling figures; terrace with domed buliding in background. Blue-green, lemon, yellow, and deep mallow red.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal strip: deer hunt. In center, a deer holds two hounds at bay while a horseman and hound approach from the left. In brown and various shades of green.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Vertical. Under central evergreen tree, a shepherd leaning on staff, a goat, and a cow. In tree, an owl and woodpecker. Blue-green, yellow, and mallow red.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal. Circle of picnickers in a mountain setting, engaged in playing a guessing game in which one player, kneeling, buries his head in the lap of another while the rest touch the upturned hand which lies across his back. Carmine, green, yellow.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal strip. Hunter and hounds pursuing rabbits, the action directed toward the right, with the figures located between three groups of trees. Two tones of green, brown, and red.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal strip and two loose deer. In center, mounted hunter and hound; at right, two deer and hunter with hounds on leash. Action directed toward the left. In several shades of brown and green.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal strip: bear hunt. At left a hunter on charging horse approaches a clearing in which two dogs are struggling with a bear; at right, a lone bear leaves unnoticed. In greens and browns with touches of red.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal strip: bear hunt. At left, a bear on its haunches crushes a hound with its foreleg as two other cogs rush it. At the right a hunter shoots a bear at close range. Colors green and brown, the hunter's coat yellow.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal strip: boar hunt. At left, a hunter stands behind tree as a boar charges toward him. To the right: a fallen tree, a boar, hound, and horseman. The colors are green, brown, dull yellow, and red.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink and watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Off-white band embroidered in red with the motto "liberta."

value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered

value: One wide and two narrow borders in geometric forms.

value: Medium: linen Technique: grid of withdrawn element work with needle lace, reticella style

value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace and deflected work in peasant style

value: Tape arranged in pattern of flowers and leaves and joined by needlework.

value: Flowers and leaves on undulating stem with scalloped border.

value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, Binche ground

label: Description
value: Men's wrapper (hinggi) with horizontal bands displaying horse, bird (maybe rooster), and snake or 'naga' motifs. Also features a middle band of diamond lattice. Colored in black, orange, tan, white, and blue. Warp fringe at both ends.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: tied resist patterning in warp (ikat) on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Description and directions for setting up a loom, including sketches of heddle arrangements, and finished samples of 102 different textiles. Directions in German script. Bound in worn grayish buckram with "Fried. Rölker" stamped in gold letters on the front cover.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Pattern of polychrome diamonds. Fragment of bonnet or bag

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Panel made up of three sections pieced together with bands of linen bobbin lace. Embroidered design of vases, two with handle and spout, containing flowers and flanked by peacocks, birds and animals. Narrow floral border on right and along bottom. One end has linen bobbin lace edging. Embroidery in red, blue, green, yellow and white silks.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Fragment of a pattern featuring courtly entertainment with man seated on throne, two male servants, bowls of fruit or sweetmeats, and a dancer. An interior setting is indicated by pillars and drawn back curtains. Sad colors in roses and blue on what was once a gold background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: Technique: plain weave with complementary wefts and inner warps (taquete)

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 50.8 x 33.8 cm (20 x 13 5/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Panel with pointed top. Natural colored ground. Lower half has two broad bands, each band having two cows with all-over design of red hand prints, on each side of central lunette enclosing figure of a man. These bands are separated by a band of lotus blossoms on water and a floral ornamental band, both of which are repeated for border at bottom. At top a pillow (?) with a peacock over it and flanked on each side by a woman carrying a bowl. Floral border repeated at top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton; polychrome Technique: painted and dyed

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Patchwork quilt top made of six broad whole-cloth strips and five narrow patchwork strips. The patchwork strips are made up of small square and triangular pieces in tans, browns, and dark blue. The strips on the two outer edges have a very distinctive leaf pattern on a lattice ground in off-white on brown, while the whole-cloth strips in the center are a small-scale floral in blue and tan on a brown ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: pieced and sewn patchwork of roller-printed plain weave fabrics

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. J. Insely Blair

label: Description
value: Round pointed hat with a shoulder cape. Dark blue silk with all-over closely-spaced formalized flower design in red, yellow, green and cream silks and round bits of mirror glass. Backed with heavy red cotton.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, mirror glass Technique: plain cloth embroidered with silks and mirror glass

label: Description
value: Yellow ground embroidered with a highly formalized floral pattern in magenta, white, blue, black, and beige silks and round pieces of mirrored glass. Fragment is rectangular with a pointed top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton, mirrored glass Technique: embroidered on twill weave

label: Description
value: Green, grey and white stripes with conventionalized ornament in ogival frames.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Cover printed in a design of flowers and pineapples in reds, blues, and tans. Two strips stitched together form cover.
